SEARCH
Package algorithm.sort.handler

Interface StepHandler<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of elements being sorted
All Known Implementing Classes:
MemoryStepHandler
public interface StepHandler<T>
A handler interface used to track the steps of a sorting algorithm.

Implementations of this interface can be used to record or visualize the intermediate states of a list during the sorting process.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    List<List<T>>
    getSteps()
    Returns a list containing all recorded steps.
    void
    onStep(List<T> currentList)
    Called to record the current state of the list during the sorting process.

  • Method Details

    • onStep

      void onStep(List<T> currentList)
      Called to record the current state of the list during the sorting process.

      Implementations should store a copy of the list if mutation is expected afterward.

      Parameters:
      currentList - the current state of the list

    • getSteps

      List<List<T>> getSteps()
      Returns a list containing all recorded steps.

      Each step is a snapshot of the list at a given point in the sorting process.

      Returns:
      the list of recorded steps
